SEARCH
Package ca.jolt.security.config

Class HeadersConfiguration

java.lang.Object
ca.jolt.security.config.HeadersConfiguration
public class HeadersConfiguration extends Object
Provides configuration for HTTP security headers including XSS protection, frame options, HSTS, referrer policy, and Content Security Policy (CSP).

This simplified version allows you to either enable CSP using a strict default configuration or supply a custom CSP string.

    • withHstsMaxAge

      public HeadersConfiguration withHstsMaxAge(long seconds, boolean includeSubDomains, boolean preload)
      Sets HSTS with a custom max-age, with options to include subdomains and preload.
      Parameters:
      seconds - the max-age in seconds.
      includeSubDomains - true to include subdomains.
      preload - true to include the preload directive.
      Returns:
      this HeadersConfiguration for fluent chaining.

    • httpsOnly

      public HeadersConfiguration httpsOnly(boolean httpsOnly)
      Enables or disables HTTPS-only mode.
      Parameters:
      httpsOnly - true to enforce HTTPS, false to allow HTTP.
      Returns:
      this HeadersConfiguration for fluent chaining.

    • contentSecurityPolicy

      public HeadersConfiguration contentSecurityPolicy(boolean enabled)
      Enables or disables Content Security Policy (CSP) using a strict default. When enabled, the default strict CSP is: "default-src 'self'; script-src 'self'; style-src 'self'; img-src 'self'; connect-src 'self';"
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable CSP using the default strict configuration.
      Returns:
      this HeadersConfiguration for fluent chaining.

    • contentSecurityPolicy

      public HeadersConfiguration contentSecurityPolicy(String policy)
      Sets a custom Content Security Policy.
      Parameters:
      policy - a custom CSP string.
      Returns:
      this HeadersConfiguration for fluent chaining.

    • withCacheControl

      public HeadersConfiguration withCacheControl(CacheControlPolicy policy)
      Sets the Cache-Control header using a predefined policy.
      Parameters:
      policy - the CacheControlPolicy to apply
      Returns:
      this HeadersConfiguration for fluent chaining.
